extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite    Level 3 in a GPHY plan, or permission of the Department.

basic.description:
Land-use history provides insights into societal interactions with the environment and can alter contemporary ecosystem properties. This integrated science, social science and humanities field course will explore the cultural and biophysical importance of land-use history. Students will do cartographic, archival, and literature research at Queen's, then carry out field research for two weeks.
NOTE    Field trips: estimated cost $350.
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Integrated Field Course in Human and Physical Geography
